CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 12, 1965, pg. 16, reads: "At Arts Festival - Numerous Pittsburgh Negro artists exhibited examples of their work and displayed their talents at the Pittsburgh Arts Festival, held in Gateway Center all of last week. in left photo, a Negro sculptor makes pottery at one of the exhibits while an audience observes him from behind a wire screen. ... Others exhibiting were Donald Paul Coleman, City Council stenotyper, of 218 Dunseith St.., who exhibited three paintings (enamels) entitled 'Wind Flowers,' 'Spring Forest' and 'The Waste Garden' and Stanley Waters Jr."
TitMainTitle: William "Bill" E. Strickland Jr. throwing a pot in ceramics booth, at Three Rivers Arts Festival, Gateway Center, Downtown
